places_to_visit.name: Plaza de Mayo
places_to_visit.description: Plaza de Mayo is a historic square in Buenos Aires, known for its significant role in Argentine history. It is home to the Casa Rosada, the presidential palace, and the Metropolitan Cathedral. The plaza has been the site of many important political and social events.

places_to_visit.name: Recoleta Cemetery
places_to_visit.description: Recoleta Cemetery is a famous and historic cemetery known for its elaborate mausoleums and statues. It is the final resting place of many notable figures, including Eva Perón. The cemetery is renowned for its architectural beauty and historical significance.

places_to_visit.name: La Boca
places_to_visit.description: La Boca is a colorful neighborhood in Buenos Aires known for its vibrant street art, tango music, and historic architecture. The area is famous for its brightly painted houses and the Caminito street, which is a popular spot for tourists and artists.

places_to_visit.name: Palermo
places_to_visit.description: Palermo is a large and trendy neighborhood known for its parks, cafes, and nightlife. It includes Palermo Soho, known for its boutiques and restaurants, and Palermo Hollywood, known for its vibrant nightlife and entertainment options.
